title: Key Fragments
body:
I've been partying up with my mates for most of my games and I believe I've only gotten **one** key fragment in the last 20 games. I find this pretty unacceptable considering I also have **four** boxes I need to open. Also, correct me if I'm wrong, aren't we suppose to get key fragments more often if we party up before games?

Anyway, what I'm trying to say here is that I believe the key fragment drop rate is too low and should be buffed.

What is everyone else's thoughts on this?

replies.body:
Right, thanks for the info. I've only opened two chests (not including the free one) and it's really frustrating me. I don't wanna spend RP on it when I can just straight up buy skins in the shop with it.

Don't worry I was in your same shoes with the 2 chests and I only got a key frag after 40 wins, worse thing was I had dunkmaster darius as a shard so it taunted me every game I didn't get a frag.

Everyone seems to be forgetting what it was like before hextek chests were released.... You payed for skins. 
Now they're giving away free skins and people aren't happy that they have to work for them.

Riot wants you to buy keys or chests. It would be bad business if they didn't.

**A good way to gain chests or keys, based on my experience:**

- Play different champions. 
- Try to play with people who can get an 'S' on their champions (or get and 'S' by yourself).

Overall though, the point of the system is to give dedicated players free items, but still make money in the process.
Just be happy they're giving us free items that are usually purchased with real money.

That is understandable. BUT you are forgetting that there are many people (like myself) that have been playing for weeks and barely gotten any key fragements or chests. Are we forgetting that there are things called gemstones aswell? If getting a single key fragement is rare imagine the drop rate of a gemstone!

League of Legends is a FREE to play game. And if someone cant afford to buy skins hextech crafting is a good way for them to get skins/icons etc.
That's understandable.

Key fragments have probably not been reset for the month yet. I feel like it has been years since I got my last key. 

Although, it is a way to get free skins and champs (something we didn't have before), so I can't really complain. 

In terms of playing in a premade and increased drop rates:
>>There's no official announcement on this sadly. Riot has chosen to hold this data privately for now. However there was a guy on Reddit a few weeks ago collecting data on this.

>You can find his post[ here.](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4atwfj/hextech_key_fragment_drop_rate_statistics/)

>According to his results there was a **5% increase** in drop chance when in a 5 man pre-made. Fairly 
decent IMO. Remember this data is quite unreliable because of changing drop rates between people.

In terms of key drops in general,

>>When asked about specifics on key fragment drop rates, **Wingfield** explained they key drop rates are not linear and the rates reset each month:
"Hey all, 
Just want to help clarify some things about key drop rates: 
Key drop rates are NOT linear and **only wins have a chance of dropping a key**. So you will earn key fragments much faster in your earlier wins than you will in your later wins. Or said another way, each incremental key fragment drop is harder than the last (on average... there is variance). This resets on a monthly basis for each player individually. 
The goal is to create a nice ebb and flow. 
Grade does NOT impact key drop chance. 
**Premades DO increase drop chance. **
Hope that helps clarify "
[(source)](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2016/03/red-post-collection-hextech-crafting-on.html#6)
Thank you for clarifying everything Yaia.

While it is annoying how few keys are dropped, we do have to remember that the whole hextech crafting system is FREE SKINS, so we are lucky to be getting anything at all, so i wouldn't complain about how hard it is to get something for free when for the entire life of the game getting a free skin has been impossible.

Riot just like any other company isn't going to give all its stuff away that easily, they wouldn't make any money. Imagine if sony just gave out free PS4's all the time, would you be mad that you didn't get one a week? or would you be just happy that you got one in the first place?

Also Key Frag drop has nothing to do with KDA or whether or not you party as far as I'm aware, it's just a RNG determining whether it drops that goes after you win a match and it's hard capped at I think 12 per month (or 4 complete keys). The drop rate for the fragments decreases slightly after each gain, similarly assuming the cap hasn't be reached and that you haven't been getting any key fragments it's said that the chances would rise in your favour instead. The drop rate reset roughly every month, it says that on Riot's official site "roughly every thirty days after you earn your first key fragment", I am not exactly sure how it all works out in detail since this is a bit vague and that whether or not forward creep is also present, but hey.

Here is my opinion of getting Chests and Key fragments:

*Key fragments* : I think you should get a key fragment whenever **you**(as the individual) get a S- or better and it should be limited to one a day.

*Chests* : I think everyone on your team should get a chest whenever you or an ally gets a S- or better. (limited to one a week)

Also with the essences they should be gifted through the chests.
